pullRequest.body:
1. `ContinuousAt.comp₂`, `ContinuousAt.comp₂_continuousWithinAt`, and `_of_eq` versions.
2. `ContinuousAt.along_{fst,snd}`: Continuous functions are continuous in their first and second arguments.

---

[![Open in Gitpod](https://gitpod.io/button/open-in-gitpod.svg)](https://gitpod.io/from-referrer/)

nodes.body: :v: girving can now approve this pull request. To approve and merge a pull request, simply reply with `bors r+`. More detailed instructions are available [here](https://bors.tech/documentation/getting-started/#reviewing-pull-requests).

Pull request successfully merged into master.

Build succeeded:
  * [Build](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/8222620773/job/22484337714)
  * [Check all files imported](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/8222620773/job/22484337793)
  * [Lint style](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/8222620773/job/22484337636)

This one is already there, as `continuous_curry`, if I'm not mistaken. But your name is maybe more discoverable. I'd call them `Continuous.curry_left` and `Continuous.curry_right` (which would be the standard mathlib names) and add your names as aliases.

Hmm, actually `continuous_curry_left` and `continuous_curry_right` both exist, but are poorly named (since they're not `Continuous.<something>`.  Should I rename them to `Continuous.curry_left` and `Continuous.curry_right`?

Also, a while ago I added [`AnalyticOn.along_fst`](https://leanprover-community.github.io/mathlib4_docs/Mathlib/Analysis/Analytic/Constructions.html#AnalyticOn.along_fst) and similar.  If desired I can add aliases called `AnalyticOn.along_fst` in a separate CL.

I can't find `continuous_curry_left` nor `continuous_curry_right`. There are `continuous_uncurry_left` and `continuous_uncurry_right`, but it's something slightly different. In any case, I agree that all these lemmas are poorly named, and that renaming them (and deprecating the previous names) is definitely a good idea!

```suggestion
-- 2024-03-09
@[deprecated] alias continuous_uncurry_left := Continuous.uncurry_left
```
To make sure we know when we can remove the deprecated alias.

pullRequest.title: [Merged by Bors] - feat: Add a few continuity lemmas for products
